Docs.summary: Represents the context information for a service instance.

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Returns the instance of the service.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance object GetServiceInstance() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Returns the instance of the service for the instance context.
Docs.returns: The object that represents the service instance.
Docs.exception: The service instance is in a created or opening state or is not initialized.
The service instance is aborted.
The service instance has been closed already and cannot be modified in these states.
The service instance is faulted and cannot be modified in these states.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance object GetServiceInstance(class System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message message) cil managed

Docs.param: The incoming message that triggered the creation of a service object.
Docs.summary: Returns the instance of the service for the instance context in response to an incoming message.
Docs.returns: The object that represents the service instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The general idea is that you only create an instance of the service when a message directed at it arrives, by calling <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CommunicationObject.Open%2A>; then if no message arrives, no <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext> is created and no service object is created, and so resources are not deployed until actually required.
## Examples [!code-csharp[S_ServiceInstanceContext#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_serviceinstancecontext/cs/snippets.cs#11)]

Docs.exception: The service instance is in a created or opening state or is not initialized.
The service instance is aborted.
The service instance has been closed already and cannot be modified in these states.
The service instance is faulted and cannot be modified in these states.

Docs.param: The additional number of messages that can be processed by the service instance.
Docs.summary: Increases the number of messages that can be processed by the service instance.
Docs.returns: The new limit on the number of messages, after is added, that can be processed by the service instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int ManualFlowControlLimit { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.ManualFlowControlLimit : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a limit on the number of messages that can be processed by the instance context.
Docs.value: The number of messages that can be processed by the instance context.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the <xref:System.ServiceModel.InstanceContext.ManualFlowControlLimit%2A> value reaches zero no more messages can be processed.
